lines.text: We have to go back!
Backstage?
No, no, no. Way back, like many million years ago!
Okay, but can we stop at a mini mart for some snacks? I have a tendency to get hungry after a couple million years.
No can do! Time's a-wasting!

[talking to the audience]
I like your hair...No, not you...I mean, that's okay, but that looks cute.
Oww! Bill? Is that you?
[a dinosaur growls]
That's your stomach growling, isn't it? I told you we should have stopped snacks.
[the dinosaur roars]
You're not Bill, are you? I mean, your name could be Bill, but you're not the Bill I'm looking for.
Ellen, what do you know about gas?

[burps]
Well, if you're stomach's bothering ya, I can get you some club soda.
That's what's going on. Got it? Good. If you don't, then that's your problem, because you're late! And you think about that next time!
Better put on these ear protectors, cos this is the Big Bang!
The piggy bank?
No! The Big Bang!
Look, Bill, I did ask for your help, but I was kind of hoping you'd like show me a slide show.
A slide show? Well, that would be easier, but this is more fun!
Are you saying that when we put gas in our cars, we run on dinosaur soup?
One of our ancestors is about to make an important discovery. A discovery that will spark the nations!
Let's hope it's deodorant.
Oh, wait, wait, I know this one! Black gold. Texas tea. Swimming pools. Movie stars. What is the Beverly Hillbillies! Uh, I mean... What is Oil.

[to a flashback of herself]
Hey, you! How about sharing some of those chips?
Of course, nobody locks their doors in New York.
Without energy, nothing would happen!
Then we'd really be in jeopardy, wouldn't we?
I'll take a nap for $100.
Sorry, Ellen. We were looking for something more than just an embellishment of what I just said.
Is this a nightmare or what?
Oh, Ellen, your first correct response!
60 years? That's 10 more than 50! 20 more than 40! 30 more than 30!
How are ya? No need to answer.
